brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts how the Physical Layer decodes framed media signals into binary code. Various frame signals correspond to various patterns of zeros and ones.

Physical Signal Patterns:
-A specific physical signal pattern indicates the start of the frame.
-Physical signals represent frame contents.
-A specific signal pattern indicates the end of the frame.
-Random unframed signals on physical media are from noise or interference.

Binary Bit Patterns:
-A specific bit pattern indicates the start of the frame.
-Bit pattern represents frame contents passed to the Data Link Layer.
-A specific bit pattern indicates the end of the frame.
-Unframed signals are not decoded and not passed to the Data Link Layer.
